description: Strict liability for abnormally dangerous activity
facts: Construction company used dynamite for demolition
Despite all safety precautions, debris flew into neighboring property
Neighbor's car was damaged by the debris
The company followed all industry safety standards
asp_facts: claim(c1). claim_type(c1, strict_liability). defendant(c1, construction_co). plaintiff(c1, neighbor). activity_type(c1, blasting). abnormally_dangerous(c1, yes). reasonable_care(c1, yes). actual_cause(c1, yes). proximate_cause(c1, yes). damages(c1, 8000). damage_type(c1, property).
question: Is the construction company liable for the damage?
rationale: Blasting/dynamite use is considered an abnormally dangerous activity. Under strict liability, the defendant is liable regardless of the level of care exercised. The company is liable even though it followed all safety standards.
